description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5egg4","text":"Protocol for α-synuclein (αSyn) proximity ligation assay (PLA) for detecting α-synuclein oligomers in rodents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2q931","text":"Add 2 µL of Conjugation buffer from the Duolink PLUS (Merck, DUO92009-1KT) or Duolink MINUS (Merck, DUO92010-1KT) probes to rabbit anti-alpha-synuclein polyclonal antibody (Merck, AB5038P).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h30j","text":"NOTE: Consider that primary antibody should be made in goat, rabbit or mouse and should be in amine-free buffer at a concentration of 1mg/mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":141}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ff979","text":"Mix by gently pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a9mrk","text":"Transfer the antibody solution to one vial of lyophilized oligonucleotides (PLUS or MINUS).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3jhke","text":"Incubate at room temperature overnight. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1vnnb","text":"Add 2 µL of Stop Reagent to the reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2vpqj","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ec7mt","text":"Add 24 µL of Storage Solution and store it at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"et103","text":"Rat formalin-fixed paraffin embedded tissue blocks from the substantia nigra sectioned at 5µm were incubated in the oven at 60°C for 30 minutes to melt the paraffin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dt73u","text":"To remove the paraffin, sections were submerged in Xylene (Panreac Applichem, 211769.2714) for 3 x 3 minutes, followed by rehydration in decreasing ethanol concentrations (100% ethanol for 2 x 5 minutes, 95% ethanol for 2 x 5, 70% ethanol for 2x5 minutes) and distilled H2O for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"chni9","text":"To unmask epitopes, sections were submerged in citrate buffer 10mM, pH6 and incubated in water bath at 95ºC for 20 minutes followed by 20 minutes at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fha53","text":"Slides were then washed 2 x 5 minutes in PBS 1x-triton 0,5% buffer followed by 1 x 5 minutes in PBS 1x buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7tc7i","text":"For the blocking, tissue sections were dried and circled with a hydrophobic pen (Vector laboratories, NC9545623). Tissue sections were then incubated in Duolink blocking solution from Duolink PLUS or MINUS (1 – 2 drops/section).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ce9i","text":"Slides were washed 2 x 5 minutes in 1x Wash Buffer A (Merck, DUO82049-4L).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cpr0c","text":"Slides were washed 2 x 5 minutes in 1x Wash Buffer A (Merck, DUO82049-4L).     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bgv0t","text":"Conjugated primary antibodies (PLUS and MINUS) were diluted at 1:500 with the antibody diluent. Tissue sections were then incubated with the primary antibodies 1 overnight at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dtfi7","text":"For ligation, 5x Duolink ligation buffer was diluted in 1:5 high purity water and then mixed to create the ligation buffer. Ligase was then diluted in ligation buffer at 1:40. Tissue sections were then incubated 30 minutes at 37ºC. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhfdg","text":"NOTE: Wait to add the ligase until immediately prior to addition to the sample. Make sure ligation buffer is completely thawed and mixed well prior to usage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":157}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dlbgj","text":"Tissue sections were then incubated with DAPI (Thermo Fisher Scientific, H3570) at 1:5000 for 10 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ltju","text":"For amplification, 5x Duolink amplification buffer was diluted in 1:5 high purity water and then mixed to create the amplification buffer. Polymerase was then diluted in amplification buffer at 1:80. Tissue sections were then incubated 100 minutes at 37ºC. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akugs","text":"NOTE: Wait to add the polymerase until immediately prior to addition to the sample. The Amplification buffer is light-sensitive. Protect all solutions containing buffer from light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":180}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"inf","text":"For final washes, slides were washed 2 x 10 minutes 1x Wash Buffer B (Merck, DUO82049-4L) and in 0.01x Wash B for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9sjem","text":"Slides were mounted with DAKO (Merck, F4680) and stored at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Protocol for α-synuclein (αSyn) proximity ligation assay (PLA) for detecting α-synuclein oligomers in rodents
title_html: Protocol for α-synuclein (αSyn) proximity ligation assay (PLA) for detecting α-synuclein oligomers in rodents
